AFTCoop 0.1.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Compute Cross-validation for a Single Fold in AFT Cooperative Estimation

    cv.aftcoop_fold.Rd

    Internal function that performs cross-validation computations for a single fold in the cooperative Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) model estimation. This function handles data standardization, model fitting, and prediction error calculation for one specific fold of k-fold cross-validation.

    cv.aftcoop_fold(
  folds,
  k,
  X,
  Xtilde,
  Y,
  delta,
  sigma = NULL,
  lambda = NULL,
  rho = NULL,
  nfolds = NULL,
  model
)

    Arguments

    folds

    List object containing fold information from cvTools::cvFolds

    k

    Integer indicating the current fold number

    X

    Matrix of combined covariates

    Xtilde

    Matrix of cooperative term covariates for cooperative estimation

    Y

    Vector of log observed survival times or log censored times (response variable in log scale)

    delta

    Vector of censoring indicators (1 for event, 0 for censored)

    sigma

    Scale parameter for the AFT model

    lambda

    Vector of regularization parameters

    rho

    Cooperation parameter

    nfolds

    Number of cross-validation folds

    model

    Character string specifying the AFT model type

    Value

    A list containing:

    • preds: Matrix of predictions for test set observations (rows) across different lambda values (columns)

    • cv.err.obj: Vector of prediction errors for each lambda value

    Details

    The function performs the following steps for a single fold:

    • Splits data into training and test sets based on fold indices

    • Standardizes both X and Xtilde matrices using training set statistics

    • Computes the cooperative term using standardized Xtilde

    • For each lambda value:

      • Fits the model using proximal gradient descent

      • Computes predictions on the test set

      • Calculates prediction error

    Note

    Last change 03/04/2025

    Implementation Details

    • Uses efficient matrix operations (crossprod instead of t(X) %*% X)

    • Implements warm starts for beta initialization across lambda values

    • Handles standardization internally to ensure proper scaling

    See also

    cv.coop for the main cross-validation function proxGD.coop for the underlying model fitting function

    Contents

    Developed by Claudia Angelini, Daniela De Canditiis, Italia De Feis, Antonella Iuliano.
